summary: The Transparency in Banking Act (S.940) mandates that specific federal agencies (Federal Reserve, OCC, FDIC) report annually to Congress on the Basel Committee on Bank Supervision. The report must detail meeting goals, attendees, proposed standards, and anticipated impacts. Furthermore, the bill requires these agencies to inform Congress of any significant changes to planned activities within 30 days, including meeting results, minutes summaries, and the positions taken by U.S. representatives. Testimony before relevant congressional committees will also include details from the annual reports.
